TopicTitle: Star Trek: Original vs Next Gen

Articles.Content:
Which of the Star Trek series do you like best: Original or the Next Generation ?

We will NOT even discuss how BAD Voyager (series) was; god the producers could not even stomach it !

I loves me some TNG

Also, why bring up VOY if we're not going to discuss it? =P

voyager from the getgo was bad. it never got good. even when practically every episode was a borg episode, it sucked (and it took the borg down to the same suck level in the process). enterprise at least tried to dig itself out of the gutter, had a few good episodes toward the end. but the damage to trek's rep was impossible to recover at that point, the new movies are ok, but its just not the same. this is why im now a whovian. daleks > borg.
DS9...
IÃ‚Â´d also go with DS 9 ... liked all series however .. but my favorite villain definitely is Q

Deep Space Nine wound up being my favorite. When I wound up rewatching Voyager two years ago on Netflix, it was significantly better than I remembered. Among other things, "Bride of Chaotica" is the best holodeck episode in the entire franchise. "Living Witness" is one heck of an episode with a less-than-stellar conclusion. There are some bad ones, but there are always bad episodes. When I rewatched TNG, I was stunned that it was renewed after the first season.

While, overall, Voyager is the weakest of the TNG-era Trek series (And I can rant for hours about how crazy Voyager did get), for the time, it was a pretty good sci-fi show. Even Enterprise was better than I initially recalled.

Alas, I'm not old enough to remember first-run TOS, and as a result, I didn't have sufficient nostalgia for it to really sustain a full watch-through. Perhaps I'll go back and take another swing at it.

Is it wrong that I like VOY? >.>

Probably because I never watched star trek thinking it was some "Stupid brain-rotting sci-fi show" until 2 years ago.

All of the Trek series are uneven, and all have many abominable episodes. But the quality of the acting was best on TOS, and its best episodes are better than the best episodes of any other series. Thank goodness they stopped with Voyager, though, eh? Before they really embarrassed themselves with something wretched.
I started out with TOS, and i saw i few episodes of TNG and i was hooked on that till i had watched Every single episode. So i'd have to say both.

Also, why bring up VOY if we're not going to discuss it? =P

To stop myself from starting a RANT about how BAD "Captain" Janeway is for turning Borg into a pet hu-man.

GAHHHH ! Janeway is not even EVIL !!!

Edited December 1, 2013 by Lohan2008

It's easiest to judge Star Trek series by their respective Captain, so I order them thusly:

1.) TNG because Picard. Absolutely nothing more needs to be said, he's such boss. I suppose his weakness is his inexplicable adherence to the Prime Directive (sometimes he refuses to budge, and others he bends over backward to ignore it).

2.) DS9 because of Sisko's confidence. He started pretty meh, but grew on me. Other than that, I put DS9 second because of the other characters.

3.) Enterprise because Archer was okay with going rogue. Reminiscent of Kirk, I suppose.

4.) Voyager because Janeway is still better than Kirk, but not by much.

5.) TOS because literally half of Kirk crew dies at some point. Worst. Captain. Ever.

DS9

TOS

TNG

VOY

ENT

In that order...
dunno... i grew up on TOS and actually rewatched the whole series on netflix not too long ago... its got some classic episodes and spock... i think i'm going to have to go with spock > data...

As i've never been a star trek fan (dont get me wrong I will watch it but im just your average viewer)

As an average viewer standpoint i got to say I enjoyed Voyager the most. I remember it was one of the few tv shows the whole family would watch once a week. I dont really like ds9 or next gen as i found them a little boring but voyager is very much aimed at the broadest audience possible rather than apealing to sci fi fans.

This is obviously personal opinion and will most likely get shot down.

What i would like to ask is how people compare the new movies to the old ones (the next gen movies and the originals) I will admit I quite like the originals for some silly reason but the new ones have plenty of lens flare and special effects so simple people like me get to enjoy it
Hmph. Voyager was my favourite series, followed by TNG. I like the TOS movies a lot more than the series. Was never a fan of DS9. Mostly watched star trek as a kid, so I tended to find it boring.

I would call myself a fullblood trekkie. And while I'd clearly vote tng here because Picard is a captain that really imbodies the whole star trek philosophy, I don't understand the bashing. Every series had its bad episodes . (Whip wielding, fur clad ferengi anyone?)

And every series is bad at the beginning. TNG gets better once riker has a beard, DS9 once sisko shaves his head and VOY once Kes is gone. Don't get me wrong, I love everyone of them. But, like with a real lover, you also have to realize and accept their shortcommings

And I thought religious and political discussions were not allowed on these forums!

I grew up with TNG and therefore it will always be what every other Star Trek incarnation will be measured to.

But I do not dislike TOS - and even VOY has its moments. *duck*

because Picard is a captain that really imbodies the whole star trek philosophy

And his pupil Data learned quite a lot.

Edited December 2, 2013 by KerbMav

I prefer TOS over TNG, but Picard over Kirk. Spock over Data. I don't find VOY that bad at all. I haven't watched much of DS9 and ENT yet, unfortunately. In my opinion, the new movies (2009 and 2013) are horrible.

Next gen all the way. Number 1. Engage. Q. Jordi's visor. Data. Klingons on the bridge. The Borg. The Holodeck...

I could go on and on about the things done in TNG. The original did have the world's first televisual interracial kiss I believe. When Kirk and O-what's-her-face got it on. Kind of awesome.

But yeah, TNG all the way. Both great.
Babylon 5 was better than all of them.

Babylon 5 was better than all of them.

^ this. at least up until the 5th season where they ruined everything by starting more story arcs than it was possible to finish before the show got canned.

Babylon 5 had some very interesting storylines, but the acting was atrocious. The thing is, I've seen many of those actors do good work in other things, so I can only conclude that somebody was requiring them to ham it up.
TOS is hilarious, TNG takes itself a bit too seriously.

Well, I bet that ENT would have become an awesome series to if they hadn't canceled it.

The second and third season had some awesome episodes - I really liked the Babel One - United - Aenar triplet.

Although best episode ever is obviously In the Pale Moonlight (DS9)

Awesome VOY episodes include Living Witness, Tinker Tenor Doctor Spy (John le Carre anyone?) or Course: Oblivion (a real brainf*ck).

So, you see - every series had awesome episodes
i like how everyone is forgetting the animated series.
